text: He's absolutely right, you know? And that's not opinion but fact. Look it up.

text:
This song have been one of my absolute favorites. The epic feeling you get from it is overwhelming, it's impossible to match it.
The soundtrack from this game is the only one I got so many favorites. If I would pick my top 20 VGM's, I could easily fill the whole list with only Chrono Cross songs without thinking that a single song didn't deserve to be there, and no kidding here, I've been thinking that a lot.
My second favorite OST gotta be the Wild Arms series though

text: To all those who argue and get into heated conversations regarding which game is superior aesthetically and artistically, regarding substance and material (gameplay, the story/narrative, graphics, replayability) - let me ask you this: Does Square (formerly Squaresoft now Square Enix) ever dissapoint?  My childhood (am now 17) was defined by a few games - yet none had the emotional and psychological impact as "Kingdom Hearts" (Grand Theft Auto III as well).
author: BECINE93

text: How come when i'm on any crono trigger or crono cross video i see comparisons between the 2 games? they were both AMAZING games. and they were made by the same people. so stop argueing about it!
author: mastergame5

text:
@GeraldRobotnik That's the problem. You have to read a compendium to really see the links between the games. :/
I'm glad people can appreciate Chrono Cross, but personally, I did not like the gameplay too much. Most characters were lifeless and redundant and the battle system felt really boring and unnecessary. OST and Story are top notch, but the rest didn't cut it for me. :[

text: I realise people don't like this guy's comment, but why the hell does youtube think we need protecting from dissenting opinions?  Voting down people whose opinion you don't like to the point where you can't even see their comment, it's ostritch-head-in-sand-problem.
author: Ashley Nu

text: CT was and is a far superior game.  It's storyline actually made sense.  It was because of the subpar nature of CC that it was linked to CT to boost sales - their stories are completely separate and they should have never attempted to link them as the link does not make any sense whatsoever.
author: Pennsylvania PumpkinPie

text:
Sub-par criticism can hardly give Chrono Cross or Chrono Trigger any justice.
Chrono Trigger was far from being sub-par when it came out. Even now it stands apart in the way it gives players a sense of timelessness, which coupled with its incredible graphics, storyline, gameplay, and music make it one of the best games ever.
However, that doesn't mean I won't pay homage to Chrono Cross, as it has everything you mentioned. It just feels pointless to compare the two, when both games are so good.
